Sorceries.Name: Soul Arrow
Sorceries.Description: Fires a magical projectile. Excellent starting spell which does very good damage against most enemies in the early game areas.

Sorceries.Name: Big Hat Logan
Sorceries.Description: Stronger soul arrow, same cast time as soul arrow, fewer uses.

Sorceries.Name: Heavy Soul Arrow
Sorceries.Description: Stronger than greater soul arrow, longer casting time.

Sorceries.Name: Great Heavy Soul Arrow
Sorceries.Description: Stronger than heavy soul arrow, fewer uses. Has a slow cast time, but deals a tremendous amount of damage, even against bosses.

Sorceries.Name: Homing Soulmass
Sorceries.Description: Fires multiple, homing magic projectiles. Can be successfully cast without an initial 'lock on'. Multiple soul arrows will hover above the player.

Sorceries.Name: Homing Crystal Soulmass
Sorceries.Description: Fires multiple, homing crystal projectiles. Can be successfully cast without an initial 'lock on'. Multiple crystal arrows will hover above the player.

Sorceries.Name: Crystal Soul Spear
Sorceries.Description: Fire an even more powerful, piercing ranged attack.

Sorceries.Name: White Dragon Breath
Sorceries.Description: A straight line of crystals pop out of the ground in front of you, shooting towards your target. One advantage of this spell is that it will take out large groups of enemies if they are lined up one behind the other. It has a medium cast time, but once it fires, it will take out anything in its path. 20 casts make this a great high level replacement for the soul arrow at high levels, as it's not as useful on most bosses.

Pyromancies.Name: Fireball
Pyromancies.Description: Standard pyromancy of the Great Swamp. Hurl fireball.
Location: Starting spell for the Pyromancer class.

Pyromancies.Name: Fire Orb
Pyromancies.Description: Pyromancy which improves upon Fireball. Hurl fire orb.

Pyromancies.Name: Great Fireball
Pyromancies.Description: Ultimate fireball pyromancy. Hurl giant fireball.

Pyromancies.Name: Great Chaos Fireball
Pyromancies.Description: Hurl giant chaos fireball, leaving a large amount of temporary lava
Location: Joining Chaos Servant covenant (Daughter of Chaos after Quelaag) (Covenant)

Pyromancies.Name: Firestorm
Pyromancies.Description: Primal pyromancy taught by Quelana of Izalith. Erect fire pillars in vicinity. Note: Uses 17 uses per cast.

Pyromancies.Name: Fire Tempest
Pyromancies.Description: Primal pyromancy of Quelana of Izalith. Erect giant fire pillars in vicinity. Note: Uses 17 uses per cast.
Location: Quelana gives it to you after finishing her favor (Gift/Drop)

Pyromancies.Name: Chaos Storm
Pyromancies.Description: Erect localized chaos fire pillars which leave blobs of temporary lava Note: Like firestorm and leaves a little lava behind.
Location: Rank 2 in Chaos Servant (30 humanities total) (Covenant)

Pyromancies.Name: Combustion
Pyromancies.Description: Elementary pyromancy. Create powerful flame in hand Note: Good 'melee' range spell, very quick too.

Pyromancies.Name: Fire Surge
Pyromancies.Description: Pyromancy foreign to the Great Swamp. Create a surge of flame from palm of hand. Note: Rapid fire spell you can cast while moving.
Location: Drop from the Bloated Dredge located after passing two illusory walls under the well, in Painted World of Ariamis (Drop)

Pyromancies.Name: Fire Whip
Pyromancies.Description: Primal pyromancy taught by Quelana of Izalith. Sweep foes with fire whip. Note: Uses 21 uses per cast. Note: Hits twice/cast.

Pyromancies.Name: Chaos Fire Whip
Pyromancies.Description: Sweep foes with chaos fire whip with lava traces Note: Leaves lava behind for a bit. Follows same mechanics as Fire Whip.
Location: Chest in Lost Izalith - turn right at the boss fog, it is down the path and around the corner guarded by a Chaos Eater (Treasure)

Pyromancies.Name: Poison Mist
Pyromancies.Description: Breathes out a cone of poison mist that fills the surrounding area causing poison status.
Location: Eingyi, the Egg-burdened NPC near the Daughter of Chaos sells this. (You need to be an Egg-head to be able to purchase this.)

Pyromancies.Name: Toxic Mist
Pyromancies.Description: Breathes out a cone of toxic mist that fills the surrounding area causing toxic status.
Location: Eingyi, the Egg Burdened NPC near the Daughter of Chaos. (You need to be an Egg-head to be able to purchase this.) (25,000 souls)

Pyromancies.Name: Acid Surge
Pyromancies.Description: Pyromancy foreign to the Great Swamp. Emit acid which corrodes weapons and armor damaging their durability. Does not affect user.
Location: In the graveyard area to the right side as you enter near the edge of the cliff in the Painted World of Ariamis (Treasure)

Pyromancies.Name: Flash Sweat
Pyromancies.Description: Covers the player in water, reduces fire damage.

Pyromancies.Name: Iron Flesh
Pyromancies.Description: Self-buff, raises defenses and poise. Note: User becomes heavy and unable to move freely: can only walk, can't run, sprint, roll, or jump.

Pyromancies.Name: Power Within
Pyromancies.Description: Increases Attack and Defense but gradually drains HP

Pyromancies.Name: Undead Rapport
Pyromancies.Description: Advanced pyromancy of Quelana of Izalith. Charm undead and gain temporary allies. Melee ranged support spell with about 2-second cast time.

Pyromancies.Name: Black Flame
Pyromancies.Description: Similar to Great Combustion. Melee-range pyromancy. Main difference with Great Combustion is that when Black Flame is blocked, it consumes a much higher amount of stamina than Great Combustion, making this pyromancy great for breaking guards.
Location: Found on a corpse in the Chasm of the Abyss. (AotA Only)

Miracles.Name: Heal
Miracles.Description: Heals a moderate amount of the caster's HP, depending on faith.

Miracles.Name: Great Heal Excerpt
Miracles.Description: Cut down version of Great Heal. Heals a large amount of HP to the caster. (NOTE: This spell does not affect allies as the erroneous load screen info would have you believe.)

Miracles.Name: Great Heal
Miracles.Description: Heals a large amount of the caster's HP, depending on faith.

Miracles.Name: Soothing Sunlight
Miracles.Description: Heals a large amount of HP to the caster and nearby allies. Scales with faith. Must be part of the Princess's Guard to use.

Miracles.Name: Replenishment
Miracles.Description: Gradually restores HP over time for a short duration.
Miracles.Acquired From: Received from Reah of Thorolund after rescuing her from the two hollows in the Tomb of the Giants.

Miracles.Name: Bountiful Sunlight
Miracles.Description: Gradually restores HP over time for a short duration to you and nearby allies. Must be part of the Princess's Guard to use.

Miracles.Name: Force
Miracles.Description: AoE effect that does no damage but knocks back most surrounding enemies. Must be very close to cause knockdown. Can deflect sorceries such as Homing Soulmass.

Miracles.Name: Wrath of the Gods
Miracles.Description: A fast casting force spell that deals high damage in a bubble around you. One of the most powerful offensive miracles in the game. Can deflect sorceries.

Miracles.Name: Emit Force
Miracles.Description: Shoots a large ball of force energy to explode on the target causing damage to the target and close surrounding enemies. Can deflect sorceries.
Miracles.Acquired From: After you clear Anor Londo, Siegmeyer of Catarina will appear at Firelink Shrine. When you talk to him he will ask if you opened the gates to Sen's Fortress. Say 'yes' and you will receive the miracle.

Miracles.Name: Magic Barrier
Miracles.Description: Reduces incoming magic damage for a short duration. (70%)?

Miracles.Name: Great Magic Barrier
Miracles.Description: As Magic Barrier but reduces even more magic damage. (90%)?

Miracles.Name: Homeward
Miracles.Description: Transports you back to the last used bonfire.

Miracles.Name: Seek Guidance
Miracles.Description: The Seek Guidance miracle allows the player to see more messages on the ground as well as their positive and negative ratings. Additional developer messages, providing hints, can also be seen in some areas.

Miracles.Name: Karmic Justice
Miracles.Description: Karmic Justice is a self-buff that lasts for 1 minute. If the player takes successive hits in PHYSICAL damage (meaning melee and non-magical), the spell explodes, dealing massive damage to all nearby enemies and knocking them all down. A very effective miracle for players who wear cloth armor with no poise. If they get stunlocked by a combo, this spell can save you from certain death.

Miracles.Name: Vow of Silence
Miracles.Description: An AoE silence around you that stops all casting in the area, including your own, for about 25 seconds. Does not scale with faith.

Miracles.Name: Tranquil Walk of Peace
Miracles.Description: Applies a debuff to nearby enemies which slows movement speed, that lasts for about 10 seconds.
Miracles.Acquired From: Catacombs - From the second bonfire, go across the bridge to the spiral tower with two skeletons. There's a breakable wall with a big skeleton behind it. Go through a hole on the right side of the room and follow it up until you get to a necromancer. There's an easily missable ladder and the miracle is at the top.

Miracles.Name: Lightning Spear
Miracles.Description: A powerful spear of light that inflicts lightning damage. Scales with faith. Can be thrown into bodies of water to cause AoE. (Puddles, lakes, etc.)

Miracles.Name: Great Lightning Spear
Miracles.Description: A larger, more powerful spear of light that inflicts lightning damage. Scales with faith. Can be thrown into water to cause AoE. (Puddles, lakes, etc.)
Miracles.Acquired From:
Covenant: Warrior of Sunlight
Requires rank 1 in the covenant.

Miracles.Name: Sunlight Spear
Miracles.Description: A very powerful version of the lightning spear. Fewer charges but a lot more damage. Scales with faith. Can be thrown into water to cause AoE. (Puddles, lakes, etc.) Must remain part of Warriors of Sunlight to use.
Miracles.Acquired From:
Covenant: Warrior of Sunlight
Requires Soul of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder and rank 1 in the covenant.

Miracles.Name: Sunlight Blade
Miracles.Description: Coats right hand weapon in lightning. Adds 1.8x your talisman's Magic Adjustment value as Lightning Damage.
Miracles.Acquired From: Defeat Dark Sun Gwyndolin by entering the fog at the Blade of the Darkmoon altar. This will irreversibly cause the Anor Londo firekeeper to become hostile and will break your oath with Blade of the Darkmoon. You will be unable to join the covenant until the next playthrough.

Miracles.Name: Darkmoon Blade
Miracles.Description: Boosts right hand weapon with rays of Darkmoon. Adds 1.8x your talisman's Magic Adjustment value as Magic Damage at Covenant Rank 0. Scaling increases by 0.1x for each rank to a maximum of 2.1x at Covenant Rank 3. Must be a member of the Darkmoon covenant to use.
Miracles.Acquired From:
Covenant: Darkmoon
Offer 10 Souvenirs of Reprisal to Gwyndolin to get to Rank 1 in order to obtain it.

Miracles.Name: Gravelord Sword Dance
Miracles.Description: AoE miracle similar to Gravelord Nito's 'scream sword' attack. Several swords will pierce the ground impaling enemies in the area. Miracle is very effective when used in close quarters such as hallways or bridges as several swords may impale the same enemy. Note: Each casting costs 20 uses.

Miracles.Name: Gravelord Greatsword Dance
Miracles.Description: Upgraded version of Gravelord Sword Dance miracle. Area of effect is expanded and increased damage.
Miracles.Acquired From:
Covenant: Gravelord Servant
Requires rank +1 in the covenant.

Miracles.Name: Escape Death
Miracles.Description: Escape Death is a self-buff that prevents the user from losing souls and humanity after death. The miracle will not work if the user has two other self-buffs active (i.e. having both the Green Blossom stamina regen effect and the Transient Curse's effect will prevent the use of this miracle). Upon death, the message 'Magic Revived' appears in green lettering identical to the 'Ring Revival' message produced when a player dies with a Ring of Sacrifice equipped.
Miracles.Acquired From: Unobtainable by normal means; the miracle lacks an icon when viewed on the Attune Magic page or in the player's spell slots, so the game developers likely did not finish it.
